title: Jhin Passive Total AD Calculation
body:
I've read the wiki page several times already and still dint understand how Jhin's passive calculation works, anyone care to shade some light? 
"his attack damage is increased by 2% - 40% (based on level) (+ 4% per 10% critical strike chance) (+ 2.5% per 10% bonus attack speed)". Does this mean: Jhin Total AD= Jhin Base AD+2 - 40% + 4%(crit from zeal) + 2.5%(from some attack speed item). Also from the formula, does the 4% per 10% crit chance refer to 4% of crit chance or 4% of Total AD? Same for the attack speed one.

replies.body:
I'm gonna use an example with completely made up numbers (to make this easy for me lol)

say jhin has 50 base AD, is level 8 (from the wiki this gives a 10% AD increase), and has items that give 50% crit chance, 40% attack speed and 50 AD.

so, his final AD would be his base + bonus AD = 100, increased by 10% from level + 20% from the crit chance + 10% from AS, which equals a 40% AD increase, giving him 140 total AD.

i bet that just made you and everyone who reads this more confused but what ever xD

1st off, this is all a percent multiplier (not a % addition) it seems from the calculations.

2ndly, it's 4% of an increase per 10% crit chance.
